channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: MRT train supplier Alstom gets green light to acquire competitor Bombardier Transportation
item.description:
August 15, 2020 2:56 PM

SINGAPORE - The competition watchdog has given the green light to French train maker Alstom's US$7 billion (S$9.6 billion) buyout of Bombardier Transportation.

item.title: 160 households of Muis beneficiaries receive korban meat
item.description:
August 15, 2020 2:00 PM

SINGAPORE - Over a hundred homes received korban meat on Saturday (Aug 15) from sheep sacrificed during Hari Raya Haji.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on Aug 15
Go 'live' on stage at new MBS studio while abroad
item.description:
August 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Speakers who are overseas will be able to go "live" on stage in Singapore despite Covid-19 travel restrictions, after Marina Bay Sands (MBS) unveiled a new hybrid event broadcast studio with hologram functionalities yesterday.

item.title: Coronavirus: Better protection for hospital staff during high-risk procedures
item.description:
August 15, 2020 5:00 AM

A hospital has come up with new box shields that offer added protection for healthcare workers performing high-risk aerosol-generating procedures on critically ill patients, including Covid-19 cases.

item.title: Transport giant in red despite govt relief
item.description:
August 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Government grants aimed at offsetting the fallout from the Covid-19 pandemic were not enough to prevent ComfortDelGro from incurring its first-ever loss.

item.title: NTUC council matches over 20,000 to jobs
item.description:
August 15, 2020 5:00 AM

The National Trades Union Congress (NTUC) Job Security Council has seen progress, with more than 20,000 workers matched with new roles amid the Covid-19 crisis.

item.title: BCA opening two 'restart clinics' to spur construction
item.description:
August 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Construction companies which need help with applying to restart work can now go to two help centres set up by the Building and Construction Authority (BCA).

item.title: Train faults delay journeys on NSL and EWL this week
item.description:
August 15, 2020 5:00 AM

A train fault extended travelling time on the North-South Line (NSL) by 15 minutes yesterday morning, the second rail glitch this week.

item.title: Events go high-tech amid Covid-19 pandemic
item.description:
August 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Speakers will be able to go "live" on stage despite Covid-19 travel restrictions at Marina Bay Sands' new hybrid event broadcast studio. The state-of-the-art studio has hologram functionalities that can beam presenters onto the stage to stand alongside in-person presenters. The studio can also accommodate a live audience of up to 50 people. Such hybrid events are likely to become the norm as Singapore resumes economic activities.

item.title: Let's face up to our own implicit bias on race
item.description:
August 15, 2020 5:00 AM

The killing of African American George Floyd by a white policeman in Minneapolis and the subsequent Black Lives Matter protests resurrected an interred personal incident.

item.title: Hyundai to make electric vehicles in Singapore
item.description:
August 15, 2020 5:00 AM

The vacuum left by Dyson has been filled. Hyundai Motor will make electric vehicles (EVs) at a plant in Jurong slated to be up and running by 2022.

item.title: Prisons not allowed to forward inmates' papers to AGC: Court
item.description:
August 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore's highest court said yesterday that the Singapore Prison Service (SPS) is not allowed to forward copies of inmates' documents to the Attorney-General's Chambers (AGC).

item.title: Fried chicken wings its way to offshore vessel - via drone
item.description:
August 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Chickens do not stay in flight for long, but airborne fried chicken can go the distance, thanks to Foodpanda's planned drone delivery service.

item.title: Komoco executive chairman Teo Hock Seng sees demand for cars continuing
item.description:
August 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Despite Singapore's continuing measures to curb its vehicle population, Mr Teo Hock Seng, executive chairman of diversified motor group Komoco Holdings, does not believe the car business is a sunset industry.

item.title: New method to administer drugs through the skin using magnets is more efficient, less painful
item.description:
August 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Those who feel faint at the sight of a needle have hope with a new drug-delivery method that involves pinching skin with magnets.

item.title: Man who took part in threesome gets jail, caning for rape
item.description:
August 15, 2020 5:00 AM

A 24-year-old man, who was roped in by another man to take part in a threesome with the latter's girlfriend without her knowledge and consent, was sentenced to 17 years and 10 months' jail and 14 strokes of the cane for rape and other sexual offences yesterday.

item.title: Port resilient amid Covid-19 pandemic as container throughput remains robust
item.description:
August 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Unlike Changi Airport, the sea port of Singapore has been more resilient amid the Covid-19 pandemic as it stays open to the movement of container boxes of cargo.

item.title: Rest of month will be warm but wetter, says weatherman
item.description:
August 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Expect wetter weather in the second half of this month, said the weatherman yesterday.

item.title: ST journalists bag awards for Covid-19 coverage
item.description:
August 15, 2020 5:00 AM

The Straits Times has won two top awards for outstanding work chronicling Singapore's Covid-19 experience.

item.title: Singapore looking at reciprocal green lanes for tourists: Ong Ye Kung
item.description:
August 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore may consider introducing reciprocal green lanes at Changi Airport for tourists from countries where the Covid-19 situation is similar to or better than that in Singapore.

item.title: Businesses hope key Covid-19 support measures will continue in the short term
item.description:
August 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Some called for wage subsidies for local workers to be extended beyond this month, as well as targeted support for severely affected industries.

item.title: Studying in China on hold for clan group scholarship winners
item.description:
August 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Five students keen to begin their overseas studies in China next month will have to wait a while more before they can fly over, due to the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: MOE will ensure education remains an effective social leveller amid Covid-19 pandemic: Lawrence Wong
item.description:
August 15, 2020 5:00 AM

The Ministry of Education will continue to focus on education as a social leveller, as well as work to ensure that schools can continue to operate even if the Covid-19 pandemic rages on, said Education Minister Lawrence Wong.

item.title: Wages council to meet soon and issue new guidelines by September
item.description:
August 15, 2020 5:00 AM

The National Wages Council (NWC) will convene later this month, for the second time this year, to tackle the growing threat to jobs posed by the coronavirus pandemic, it was announced yesterday.

item.title: Jail for guard who got drunk on shift, hurled abuse at cops
item.description:
August 15, 2020 5:00 AM

While he was out on bail for breaching Covid-19 measures, a 30-year-old got drunk with his friends in the middle of his shift as a security officer, and later shouted profanities at police officers after being taken to hospital.

item.title: Thousands matched with new work roles by NTUC job council
item.description:
August 15, 2020 5:00 AM

More than 20,000 workers have been matched with new roles amid the Covid-19 crisis by the National Trades Union Congress (NTUC) Job Security Council, said labour chief Ng Chee Meng.

item.title: Crowdfunding drive launched for victim of e-scooter accident
item.description:
August 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Unsettled by news that the family of a victim in a personal mobility device accident could go without any compensation in the near future, one 13-year-old decided to act.

item.title: NTUC weighs forming organised body to help PMEs
item.description:
August 15, 2020 5:00 AM

The labour movement is looking at creating an organised body to protect the interests of professionals, managers and executives (PMEs) during the Covid-19 crisis and beyond, said labour chief Ng Chee Meng.

item.title: Human-like robocars beyond today's tech
item.description:
August 15, 2020 5:00 AM

The technology to allow a driverless vehicle to move fully autonomously is not ready yet, according to a leading autonomous vehicle company.

item.title: Coronavirus: No new cases in community for first time since June 1
item.description:
August 15, 2020 5:00 AM

No new Covid-19 cases in the community were reported yesterday, for the first time since June 1.

item.title: Very low risk of coronavirus infection from chilled, frozen food: Experts
item.description:
August 15, 2020 5:00 AM

It is possible to get Covid-19 from contaminated imported chilled or frozen food, but the risk is very low, said experts.

item.title: Temasek slams racist Facebook posts targeting its Indian employees; observers say posts show real tensions that need to be fixed
item.description:
August 15, 2020 1:01 AM

Without referring to the incident, Ms Indranee Rajah on Saturday also warned of "toxic" xenophobia that divides the society.
